ShouldersLVInclineRearDeltRowPL.name: Lever Incline Rear Delt Row (plate loaded)
ShouldersLVInclineRearDeltRowPL.preparation: Lie chest low on inclined platform and grasp forward lever handles with wide overhand grip.
ShouldersLVInclineRearDeltRowPL.execution: Pull lever with elbows forward out to sides until upper arms are just beyond parallel, keeping upper arm perpendicular to torso. Return and repeat.
ShouldersLVInclineRearDeltRowPL.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk, latissimus dorsi becomes involved. Elbows should be kept on same movement plane as shoulders. Much lighter resistance is required as Lever Incline Row.
ShouldersLVInclineRearDeltRowPL.synergists: latissimusdorsi, infraspinatus, brachioradialis, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids

ShouldersLVLyingRearLateralRaiseH.name: Lever Lying Rear Lateral Raise (plate loaded)
ShouldersLVLyingRearLateralRaiseH.preparation: Lie on machine with chest against padding. Position arms between padded lever arms with elbows below shoulders.
ShouldersLVLyingRearLateralRaiseH.execution: Pull arms up until elbows are beyond back. Return and repeat.
ShouldersLVLyingRearLateralRaiseH.comments: Upper arm should travel in perpendicular path to torso. At lower portion of exercise, keep elbows pointed outward below shoulders. At upper portion of exercise, keep elbows pointed outward to sides of shoulders. Legs may be kept together, extending off end (as shown), or bent straddling.

ShouldersLVRearDeltRaise.name: Lever Rear Delt Raise (plate loaded)
ShouldersLVRearDeltRaise.preparation: Stand between lever handles facing away from machine. Squat down and grasp lever handles to each side. Stand up with arms straight to sides.
ShouldersLVRearDeltRaise.execution: Pull lever up as far as possible allowing elbows to travel up behind body to each side. Lower until arms are straight and repeat.
ShouldersLVRearDeltRaise.synergists: brachialis, trapeziusupper, deltoidlateral, levatorscapulae, brachioradialis, bicepsbrachii

ShouldersLVRearDeltRowHammer.name: Lever Seated Rear Delt Row (plate loaded)
ShouldersLVRearDeltRowHammer.preparation: Place seat at low position. Sit on seat with chest against pad and grasp upper handles.
ShouldersLVRearDeltRowHammer.execution: Pull lever with elbows up out to sides until upper arms are just beyond parallel, keeping upper arm horizontal, perpendicular to torso. Return and repeat.
ShouldersLVRearDeltRowHammer.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk, latissimus dorsi becomes involved. Elbows should be kept same height as shoulders. Much lighter resistance is required as Lever Seated Row or even Wide Grip Lever Seated Row.
ShouldersLVRearDeltRowHammer.synergists: latissimusdorsi, infraspinatus, brachioradialis, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids

ShouldersLVRearDeltRowC.name: Lever Seated Rear Delt Row (plate loaded)
ShouldersLVRearDeltRowC.preparation: Place seat at low position. Sit on seat with chest against pad and grasp upper handles.
ShouldersLVRearDeltRowC.execution: Pull lever with elbows up out to sides until upper arms are just beyond parallel, keeping upper arm horizontal, perpendicular to torso. Return and repeat.
ShouldersLVRearDeltRowC.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk, latissimus dorsi becomes involved. Elbows should be kept same height as shoulders. Much lighter resistance is required as Lever Seated Row or even Wide Grip Lever Seated Row. Movement can be performed on more commonly found plate loaded seated rowing machine.
ShouldersLVRearDeltRowC.synergists: latissimusdorsi, infraspinatus, brachioradialis, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids

ShouldersLVSeatedRearLateralRaise.name: Lever Seated Rear Lateral Raise (plate loaded)
ShouldersLVSeatedRearLateralRaise.preparation: Sit on seat with feet placed on platform ahead of knees. Rest torso on thighs. Reach under legs and grasp lever handles on each side.
ShouldersLVSeatedRearLateralRaise.execution: Pull lever handles out to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and fixed elbow position (10 to 30 angle) throughout exercise. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersLVSeatedRearLateralRaise.comments: Upper arm should travel in perpendicular path to torso to minimize Latissimus Dorsi involvement.
ShouldersLVSeatedRearLateralRaise.synergists: infraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids

ShouldersLVTBarRearDeltRow.name: Lever T-Bar Rear Delt Row (plate loaded)
ShouldersLVTBarRearDeltRow.preparation: Straddle lever bar facing handles. Bend knees slightly and bend over handles with back straight. Grasp wide grip handles with overhand grip. With arms extended, position torso just high enough to allow weight to make contact with floor.
ShouldersLVTBarRearDeltRow.execution: With elbows out to sides, pull bar up toward upper chest until elbows are same height as shoulders or just beyond, keeping upper arm perpendicular to torso. Return and repeat.
ShouldersLVTBarRearDeltRow.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk, latissimus dorsi becomes involved. Elbows should be raised directly lateral to shoulders. Keep torso bent over as far as possible allowing just enough height to fully extend arms. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See Hamstring Inflexibility). If low back becomes rounded due to tight hamstrings, either knees should be bent more or torso may not be positioned as low. If low back is rounded due to poor form, slowly lower torso into horizontal position with knees bent and back straight. Much lighter resistance is required as Lever TBar Row.
ShouldersLVTBarRearDeltRow.synergists: infraspinatus, rhomboids, brachioradialis, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, teresminor
